Package com.deco2800.game.areas

Class ForestGameArea

java.lang.Object
com.deco2800.game.areas.GameArea
com.deco2800.game.areas.ForestGameArea
All Implemented Interfaces:
Disposable
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelFourArea, LevelThreeArea, LevelTwoArea
public class ForestGameArea
extends GameArea
Forest area for the demo game with trees, a player, and some enemies.

    • isDead

      public boolean isDead()

    • livesCondition

      protected boolean livesCondition​(TerrainFactory.TerrainType area, int lives)
      Defines the correct 'lives' boolean to return based on the current map area. The way in which lives are reset is dependent on whether the player is on level one, or another level.
      Parameters:
      area - the area for which the conditional is being evaluated
      lives - the amount of lives the player currently has
      Returns:
      true if the players lives will be reset to MAX, else false.

    • spawnPlayer

      protected Entity spawnPlayer​(GridPoint2 playerSpawn, TerrainFactory.TerrainType area, boolean save)
      Spawns the player on the current terrain
      Parameters:
      playerSpawn - the position to spawn the player at
      area - the current map area.
      Returns:
      the new player entity.

    • createCheckpoints

      protected void createCheckpoints​(java.util.ArrayList<GridPoint2> positions, ForestGameArea area)
      Spawns the Checkpoints for the level.
      Parameters:
      positions - the position(s) to spawn the Checkpoint(s) at.
      area - the current game area.

    • spawnBuffDebuff

      public void spawnBuffDebuff​(BuffManager manager, MainGameScreen.Level screenType)
      Spawns buffs or debuffs onto the current map in a random position. Buffs are spawned on the ground only (not platforms). Buffs can spawn anywhere across the game map (horizontally). A random buff type is chosen to be spawned.
      Parameters:
      manager - the BuffManager which will handle the actions, despawning and timeout-related functionality of this buff.
      screenType - the area the buffs are currently spawning on. This allows for dynamic spawn placements between the different terrain layouts.

    • spawnBuffDebuffPickup

      public Entity spawnBuffDebuffPickup​(BuffManager.BuffPickup pickup, BuffManager manager)
      Spawns a floating animation when a HP buff/debuff is picked up. Spawns at the player and floats up
      Parameters:
      pickup - the type of animation that will be released based on which buff is picked up
      manager - the Buff Manger which will handle the actions and despawning functionality of the animation
      Returns:
      the floating animation that is spawned.

    • playMusic

      protected void playMusic​(java.lang.String musicName)
      Plays the music for the current level.
      Parameters:
      musicName - the filepath for the sound file.

    • resetCam

      public void resetCam​(CameraComponent camera, TerrainFactory.TerrainType type)
      reset the camera position when refresh every frame
      Parameters:
      camera - the CameraComponent of the map
      type - the type of terrain. Different terrain types have different camera positions.

    • resetCam

      public void resetCam​(CameraComponent camera)
      reset the camera position when refresh every frame
      Parameters:
      camera - the CameraComponent of the map

    • introCam

      public void introCam​(Vector2 startPos, float distance, float duration, CameraComponent camera)
      introducing the death wall to player by making camera stay at the start with 3.5 second and move to target with constant speed
      Parameters:
      startPos - the position of the camera spawn
      distance - the distance that the camera is going to move from start point
      duration - the total time when the camera is moving
      camera - the CameraComponent of the map

    • isPause

      public void isPause​(GdxGame.GameState state, java.util.List<Entity> areaEntities)
      Check if the game is pause, and stop the animation playing
      Parameters:
      state - The game state

    • getAreaType

      public MainGameScreen.Level getAreaType()
      Returns the TYPE associated with this area. Allows for differentiation between the four areas.
